member.name: T:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Audio.AudioContent
member.summary: Encapsulates and provides operations, such as format conversions, on the source audio. This type is produced by the audio importers and used by audio processors to produce compiled audio assets.
member.remarks: Note that AudioContent can load and process audio files that are not supported by the importers.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Audio.AudioContent.FileName
member.summary: The name of the original source audio file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Audio.AudioContent.FileType
member.summary: The type of the original source audio file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Audio.AudioContent.Data
member.summary: The current raw audio data without header information.
member.remarks: This changes from the source data to the output data after conversion. For MP3 and WMA files this throws an exception to match XNA behavior.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Audio.AudioContent.Duration
member.summary: The duration of the audio data.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Audio.AudioContent.Format
member.summary: The current format of the audio data.
member.remarks: This changes from the source format to the output format after conversion.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Audio.AudioContent.LoopLength
member.summary: The current loop length in samples.
member.remarks: This changes from the source loop length to the output loop length after conversion.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Audio.AudioContent.LoopStart
member.summary: The current loop start location in samples.
member.remarks: This changes from the source loop start to the output loop start after conversion.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Audio.AudioContent.#ctor(System.String,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Audio.AudioFileType)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of AudioContent.
member.param: Name of the audio source file to be processed.
Type of the processed audio: WAV, MP3 or WMA.
member.remarks: Constructs the object from the specified source file, in the format specified.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Audio.AudioContent.ConvertFormat(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Audio.ConversionFormat,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Audio.ConversionQuality,System.String)
member.summary: Transcodes the source audio to the target format and quality.
member.param: Format to convert this audio to.

Quality of the processed output audio. For streaming formats, it can be one of the following: Low (96 kbps), Medium (128 kbps), Best (192 kbps). For WAV formats, it can be one of the following: Low (11kHz ADPCM), Medium (22kHz ADPCM), Best (44kHz PCM)

The name of the file that the converted audio should be saved into. This is used for SongContent, where the audio is stored external to the XNB file. If this is null, then the converted audio is stored in the Data property.

member.summary: Type of the audio file.

member.param: Name of the key being modified.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.VertexContent
member.summary: Provides methods and properties for maintaining the vertex data of a GeometryContent.
member.remarks: This class combines a collection of arbitrarily named data channels with a list of position indices that reference the Positions collection of the parent MeshContent.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.VertexContent.Channels
member.summary: Gets the list of named vertex data channels in the VertexContent.
member.value: Collection of vertex data channels.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.VertexContent.PositionIndices
member.summary: Gets the list of position indices.
member.value: Position of the position index being retrieved.
member.remarks: This list adds a level of indirection between the actual triangle indices and the Positions member of the parent. This indirection preserves the topological vertex identity in cases where a single vertex position is used by triangles that straddle a discontinuity in some other data channel. For example, the following code gets the position of the first vertex of the first triangle in a GeometryContent object: parent.Positions[Vertices.PositionIndices[Indices[0]]]

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.VertexContent.Positions
member.summary: Gets position data from the parent mesh object.
member.value: Collection of vertex positions for the mesh.
member.remarks: The collection returned from this call provides a virtualized view of the vertex positions for this batch. The collection uses the contents of the PositionIndices property to index into the parent Positions. This collection is read-only. If you need to modify any contained values, edit the PositionIndices or Positions members directly.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.VertexContent.VertexCount
member.summary: Number of vertices for the content.
member.value: Number of vertices.

member.returns: Index of the new entry. This can be added to the Indices member of the parent.

member.summary: Specifies if a full chain of mipmaps are generated from the source material. Existing mipmaps of the material are not replaced.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Processors.MaterialProcessor.ResizeTexturesToPowerOfTwo
member.summary: Specifies whether resizing of a material is enabled. Typically used to maximize compatability with a graphics card because many graphics cards do not support a material size that is not a power of two. If ResizeTexturesToPowerOfTwo is enabled, the material is resized to the next largest power of two.
member.value: true if resizing is enabled; false otherwise.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Processors.MaterialProcessor.TextureFormat
member.summary: Specifies the texture format of output materials. Materials can either be left unchanged from the source asset, converted to a corresponding Color, or compressed using the appropriate DxtCompressed format.
member.value: The texture format of the output.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Processors.MaterialProcessor.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the MaterialProcessor class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Processors.MaterialProcessor.BuildEffect(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.ExternalReference{Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.EffectContent},Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.ContentProcessorContext)
member.summary: Builds effect content.
member.param: An external reference to the effect content.
member.remarks: If the input to process is of type EffectMaterialContent, this function will be called to request that the EffectContent be built. The EffectProcessor is used to process the EffectContent. Subclasses of MaterialProcessor can override this function to modify the parameters used to build EffectContent. For example, a different version of this function could request a different processor for the EffectContent.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Processors.MaterialProcessor.BuildTexture(System.String,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.ExternalReference{Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.TextureContent},Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.ContentProcessorContext)
member.summary: Builds texture content.
member.param: The name of the texture. This should correspond to the key used to store the texture in Textures.
The asset to build. This should be a member of Textures.
member.remarks: textureName can be used to determine which processor to use. For example, if a texture is being used as a normal map, the user may not want to use the ModelTextureProcessor on it, which compresses textures.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Processors.MaterialProcessor.Process(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.MaterialContent,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.ContentProcessorContext)
member.summary: Builds the texture and effect content for the material.
member.remarks: If the MaterialContent is of type EffectMaterialContent, a build is requested for Effect, and validation will be performed on the OpaqueData to ensure that all parameters are valid input to SetValue or SetValueTranspose. If the MaterialContent is a BasicMaterialContent, no validation will be performed on OpaqueData. Process requests builds for all textures in Textures, unless the MaterialContent is of type BasicMaterialContent, in which case a build will only be requested for DiffuseColor. The textures in Textures will be ignored.

member.summary: Specifies the target output (of type SurfaceFormat) of the texture processor. Used by TextureProcessor.TextureFormat.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Processors.TextureProcessorOutputFormat.Color
member.summary: The SurfaceFormat value, of the input TextureContent object, is converted to Color by the processor. Typically used for 2D graphics and overlays.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Processors.TextureProcessorOutputFormat.DxtCompressed
member.summary: The SurfaceFormat value, of the input TextureContent object, is converted to an appropriate DXT compression by the processor. If the input texture contains fractional alpha values, it is converted to DXT5 format (8 bits per texel); otherwise it is converted to DXT1 (4 bits per texel). This conversion reduces the resource's size on the graphics card. Typically used for 3D textures such as 3D model textures.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Processors.TextureProcessorOutputFormat.NoChange
member.summary: The SurfaceFormat value, of the input TextureContent object, is not changed by the processor. Typically used for textures processed by an external tool.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Processors.TextureProcessorOutputFormat.Compressed
member.summary: The SurfaceFormat value, of the input TextureContent object, is converted to an appropriate compressed format for the target platform. This can include PVRTC for iOS, DXT for desktop, Windows 8 and Windows Phone 8, and ETC1 or BGRA4444 for Android.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Processors.TextureProcessorOutputFormat.Color16Bit
member.summary: The pixel depth of the input texture is reduced to BGR565 for opaque textures, otherwise it uses BGRA4444.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Processors.TextureProcessorOutputFormat.Etc1Compressed
member.summary: The input texture is compressed using ETC1 texture compression. Used on Android platforms.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Processors.TextureProcessorOutputFormat.PvrCompressed
member.summary: The input texture is compressed using PVR texture compression. Used on iOS and some Android platforms.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Processors.TextureProcessorOutputFormat.AtcCompressed
member.summary: The input texture is compressed using ATI texture compression. Used on some Android platforms.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Processors.VertexBufferContent
member.summary: Provides methods and properties for managing a design-time vertex buffer that holds packed vertex data.
member.remarks: This type directly corresponds to the runtime VertexBuffer class, and when a VertexBufferContent object is passed to the content compiler, the vertex data deserializes directly into a VertexBuffer at runtime. VertexBufferContent objects are not directly created by importers. The preferred method is to store vertex data in the more flexible VertexContent class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Serialization.Compiler.SpriteFontContentWriter.ShouldCompressContent(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.TargetPlatform,System.Object)
member.summary: Indicates whether a given type of content should be compressed.
member.param: The target platform of the content build.
The object about to be serialized, or null if a collection of objects is to be serialized.
member.returns: true if the content of the requested type should be compressed; false otherwise.
member.remarks: This base class implementation of this method always returns true. It should be overridden to return false if there would be little or no useful reduction in size of the content type's data from a general-purpose lossless compression algorithm. The implementations for Song Class and SoundEffect Class data return false because data for these content types is already in compressed form.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.ContentImporter`1
member.summary: Implements a file format importer for use with game assets. Importers, either provided by the framework or written by a developer, must derive from ContentImporter, as well as being marked with a ContentImporterAttribute. An importer should produce results in the standard intermediate object model. If an asset has information not supported by the object model, the importer should output it as opaque data (key/value attributes attached to the relevant object). By following this procedure, a content pipeline can access specialized digital content creation (DCC) tool information, even when that information has not been fully standardized into the official object model. You can also design custom importers that accept and import types containing specific third-party extensions to the object model.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.OpenAssetImporter.FbxPivot
member.summary: Defines the frame for local scale/rotation/translation of FBX nodes.

remarks.para: The transformation pivot defines the frame for local scale/rotation/translation. The local transform of a node is:
Local Transform = Translation * RotationOffset * RotationPivot * PreRotation * Rotation * PostRotation * RotationPivotInverse * ScalingOffset * ScalingPivot * Scaling * ScalingPivotInverse
where the matrix multiplication order is right-to-left.
Local Transform = Translation * Rotation * Scaling * GeometricTranslation * GeometricRotation * GeometricScaling
Transformation pivots are stored per FBX node. When Assimp hits an FBX node with a transformation pivot it generates additional nodes named

Translation, RotationOffset, RotationPivot, PreRotation, Rotation, PostRotation, RotationPivotInverse, ScalingOffset, ScalingPivot, Scaling, ScalingPivotInverse, GeometricTranslation, GeometricRotation, GeometricScaling

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Utilities.LZ4.LZ4Codec
member.summary: Unsafe LZ4 codec.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Utilities.LZ4.LZ4Codec.MEMORY_USAGE
member.summary: Memory usage formula : N->2^N Bytes (examples : 10 -> 1KB; 12 -> 4KB ; 16 -> 64KB; 20 -> 1MB; etc.) Increasing memory usage improves compression ratio Reduced memory usage can improve speed, due to cache effect Default value is 14, for 16KB, which nicely fits into Intel x86 L1 cache

member.name: F:Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Utilities.LZ4.LZ4Codec.NOTCOMPRESSIBLE_DETECTIONLEVEL
member.summary: Decreasing this value will make the algorithm skip faster data segments considered "incompressible" This may decrease compression ratio dramatically, but will be faster on incompressible data Increasing this value will make the algorithm search more before declaring a segment "incompressible" This could improve compression a bit, but will be slower on incompressible data The default value (6) is recommended

member.returns: Maximum number of bytes needed for compressed buffer.
